verses.verse: The words <WH1697> of Agur <WH94> the son <WH1121> of Jakeh <WH3348>; The oracle <WH4853>. The man <WH1397> saith <WH5002> unto Ithiel <WH384>, unto Ithiel <WH384> and Ucal <WH401>:
Surely I am more brutish <WH1198> than any man <WH376>, And have not the understanding <WH998> of a man <WH120>;
And I have not learned <WH3925> wisdom <WH2451>, Neither have <WH3045> I the knowledge <WH1847> of the Holy One <WH6918>.

Who hath ascended up <WH5927> into heaven <WH8064>, and descended <WH3381>? Who hath gathered <WH622> the wind <WH7307> in his fists <WH2651>? Who hath bound <WH6887> the waters <WH4325> in his garment <WH8071>? Who hath established <WH6965> all the ends <WH657> of the earth <WH776>? What is his name <WH8034>, and what is his son <WH1121>'s name <WH8034>, if thou knowest <WH3045>?
Every word <WH565> of God <WH433> is tried <WH6884>: He is a shield <WH4043> unto them that take refuge in him <WH2620>.
Add <WH3254> thou not unto his words <WH1697>, Lest he reprove <WH3198> thee <WH3576>, and thou be found a liar.
Two <WH8147> things have I asked <WH7592> of thee <WH4513>; Deny me them not before I die <WH4191>:

Remove far <WH7368> from me falsehood <WH7723> and lies <WH1697>; Give <WH5414> me neither poverty <WH7389> nor riches <WH6239>; Feed <WH2963> me with the food <WH3899> that is needful for me <WH2706>:

Lest I be full <WH7646>, and deny <WH3584> thee <WH559>, and say, Who is Jehovah <WH3068>? Or lest I be poor <WH3423>, and steal <WH1589>, And use profanely <WH8610> the name <WH8034> of my God <WH430>.
Slander <WH3960> not a servant <WH5650> unto his master <WH113>, Lest he curse <WH7043> thee <WH816>, and thou be held guilty.
There is a generation <WH1755> that curse <WH7043> their father <WH1>, And bless <WH1288> not their mother <WH517>.
There is a generation <WH1755> that are pure <WH2889> in their own eyes <WH5869>, And yet are not washed <WH7364> from their filthiness <WH6675>.
There is a generation <WH1755>, oh how lofty <WH7311> are their eyes <WH5869>! And their eyelids <WH6079> are lifted up <WH5375>.

There is a generation <WH1755> whose teeth <WH8127> are as swords <WH2719>, and their jaw teeth <WH4973> as knives <WH3979>, To devour <WH398> the poor <WH6041> from off the earth <WH776>, and the needy <WH34> from among men <WH120>.

The horseleach <WH5936> hath two <WH8147> daughters <WH1323>, crying <WH3051>, Give, give <WH3051>. There are three <WH7969> things that are never satisfied <WH7646>, Yea <WH702>, four that say <WH559> not <WH1952>, Enough:
Sheol <WH7585>; And the barren <WH6115> womb <WH7356>; The earth <WH776> that is not satisfied <WH7646> with water <WH4325>; And the fire <WH784> that saith <WH559> not <WH1952>, Enough.

The eye <WH5869> that mocketh <WH3932> at his father <WH1>, And despiseth <WH936> to obey <WH3349> his mother <WH517>, The ravens <WH6158> of the valley <WH5158> shall pick it out <WH5365>, And the young <WH1121> eagles <WH5404> shall eat it <WH398>.
There are three <WH7969> things which are too wonderful <WH6381> for me <WH702>, Yea, four which I know not <WH3045>:

The way <WH1870> of an eagle <WH5404> in the air <WH8064>; The way <WH1870> of a serpent <WH5175> upon a rock <WH6697>; The way <WH1870> of a ship <WH591> in the midst <WH3820> of the sea <WH3220>; And the way <WH1870> of a man <WH1397> with a maiden <WH5959>.
So is the way <WH1870> of an adulterous <WH5003> woman <WH802>; She eateth <WH398>, and wipeth <WH4229> her mouth <WH6310>, And saith <WH559>, I have done <WH6466> no wickedness <WH205>.
For three <WH7969> things the earth <WH776> doth tremble <WH7264>, And for four <WH702>, which it cannot <WH3201> bear <WH5375>:
For a servant <WH5650> when he is king <WH4427>; And a fool <WH5036> when he is filled <WH7646> with food <WH3899>;
For an odious <WH8130> woman when she is married <WH1166>; And a handmaid <WH8198> that is heir <WH3423> to her mistress <WH1404>.
There are four <WH702> things which are little <WH6996> upon the earth <WH776>, But they are exceeding <WH2449> wise <WH2450>:
The ants <WH5244> are a people <WH5971> not strong <WH5794>, Yet they provide <WH3559> their food <WH3899> in the summer <WH7019>;
The conies <WH8227> are but a feeble <WH6099> folk <WH5971>, Yet make <WH7760> they their houses <WH1004> in the rocks <WH5553>;
The locusts <WH697> have no king <WH4428>, Yet go they forth <WH3318> all of them by bands <WH2686>;
The lizard <WH8079> taketh hold <WH8610> with her hands <WH3027>, Yet is she in kings <WH4428>' palaces <WH1964>.
There are three <WH7969> things which are stately <WH3190> in their march <WH6806>, Yea <WH702>, four which are stately <WH2895> in going <WH3212>:
The lion <WH3918>, which is mightiest <WH1368> among beasts <WH929>, And turneth not away <WH7725> for any <WH6440>;
The greyhound <WH4975>; The he-goat <WH8495> also <WH176>; And the king <WH4428> against whom there is no rising up <WH510>.
If thou hast done foolishly <WH5034> in lifting up <WH5375> thyself <WH2161>, Or if thou hast thought evil, Lay thy hand <WH3027> upon thy mouth <WH6310>.

For the churning <WH4330> of milk <WH2461> bringeth forth <WH3318> butter <WH2529>, And the wringing <WH4330> of the nose <WH639> bringeth forth <WH3318> blood <WH1818>; So the forcing <WH4330> of wrath <WH639> bringeth forth <WH3318> strife <WH7379>.
